flim_tools.io.load_sdt_data(filepath)[source]¶

Loads the data of an SDT file, reshaping the output is necessary as this outputs a 1d array

e.g. An image of length 16777216 should be reshaped to (1, 256,256,256) >>> image = np.reshape(data, (1, 256, 256, 256))

### 2ch An image of length 33554432 should be reshaped to (2 ch, 256,256,256) >>> image = np.reshape(data, (2, 256, 256, 256))

Parameters

filepath (string, pathlib path) – path to the input image

Returns

data – 1D array containing all channel and pixel data

Return type

TYPE

flim_tools.io.load_sdt_file(file_path)[source]¶

load a new sdt file :param file_path: path to the sdt file :type file_path: string

Returns

image = 3d-array representation of image

flim_tools.io.read_asc(path)[source]¶

Reads in an asc file into an array

Parameters

path (pathlib.Path) – path to the file.

Returns

array – DESCRIPTION.

Return type

ndarray
